Waggle Server Installation and Configuration¶

When running a waggle server, it is assumed that you are running a version of ubuntu on your machine, and that it is set up to clone via ssh from git.

For assistance setting up git in this way on your machine, follow these instructions: Git SSH Setup

If you are SSHing into a remote machine to set up a server, you should set up SSH forwarding according to these instructions: SSH Forwarding

To set up a machine to run as a waggle server, do the following:

  1. Clone the git repo from git@github.com:waggle-sensor/waggle.git
  2. In the cloned repo, go to the waggle/beehive directory
  3. Run the configure.sh script in the beehive directory
  4. Once this setup is complete, move to the beehive/server directory
  5. To start the server, run the command python Server.py.

Quick install¶

To do a quick install, move to the directory where you want the files and simply run these commands. (Assumes git ssh is set up.)

git clone git@github.com:waggle-sensor/waggle.git
cd waggle/beehive
./configure
cd server

Once this has been run, you can just type python Server.py and the server will start.
